Title: Anders Wind
MainText: I am a 6th semester software development student at the IT-University of Copenhagen in Denmark and a freelance developer.
AboutText:
I create software solutions for companies and people, who want to improve their work-processes with IT. I focus on making IT as easy and simple to use while solving the critical problems.
 I write code in a lot of languages but mainly focus on C# and F#.

ServicesCollection.Title: .NET
ServicesCollection.Description: A lot of experience with Microsoft's .NET platform and C# and F#

ServicesCollection.Title: Native Apps
ServicesCollection.Description: Responsive native apps for Windows 7 and 8 PCs as well as all Windows 10 devices.

ServicesCollection.Title: Cloud Services
ServicesCollection.Description: Allowing multiple services to talk together enabling you and your team to work together to solve your problems.

ServicesCollection.Title: Collaboration
ServicesCollection.Description: Collaborating with you makes sure that we reach the best solution together!

ProjectCollection.Title: Ray Tracing
ProjectCollection.Description: This project includes three implementations of the Ray Tracing algorithm. One written in C#, one in C++ and one in Java. The feature level of the implemenations vary but the C# implementation is the furthest, with both reflections, refractions, Snell's law, soft shadows, depth of field and a lot of other features

ProjectCollection.Title: Call Center System
ProjectCollection.Description:
Nordsjælland Brandvæsen (a regional firefighter emergency center) was in need of a smarter way to access routines in their call center unit. Therefore we created a native Windows client for their unit to access all of their routines as well as edit them. The project includes a web API implementation with custom and secure identification system.
The source is closed source for now but will be open sourced later on

ProjectCollection.Title: Is Cafe Analog Open?
ProjectCollection.Description: At our university we have a student cafe which sells some of the best coffee. A friend and I decided to help them out and create a small and simple Chrome extension such that thirsty students quickly can see if Cafe Analog is open or not.

ProjectCollection.Title: Distributed DCR Graphs
ProjectCollection.Description: In this project a group of me and 5 other students had to create a distributed implementation of the DCR graphs created at ITU by Thomas Hildebrandt. Furthermore a client had to be made, which should allow only certain roles to execute certain events. The architecture is based on a peer-to-peer system, where a central server is only used at graph initiation and when a client wants to access the graph. The solution is well tested and documented and SCRUM was used to manage the team over the course of the implementation.

ProjectCollection.Title: Car lot CRUD system
ProjectCollection.Description: In this project a group of me and 4 other students had to develop a Windows Client in WPF, a Asp.NET API and Application of a car lot sales system. I was in charge of the Windows Client app and recieved full marks for the assignment.

ProjectCollection.Title: Map of Denmark
ProjectCollection.Description: This project visualizes a map of Denmark and allows the user to navigate from two destinations either by clicking or writing the addresses. It is implemented in java and used Quadtrees, A* search and couple of other optimizing algorithms. The data used for drawing is OpenStreetMaps
